conclusion: Objects A and B are dropped onto the tabletop, and gravity pulls them straight down until they hit the tallest items in their fall-path.
On the left side, the tallest items in Aâ€™s path are the brown block (C) and the small pink block sitting on it (D).
The cloth A will land first on D, then drape around C, and finally sag onto the table between and around them.
On the right side, the taller green block (F) is the only object tall enough to touch the descending cloth B.
The beige cloth B will settle on F and hang down its sides.
The shorter green block (E) is low enough that the cloth passes right over it.
After both cloths finish settling, A is resting on and around C and D, while B is resting on and around F; the shorter block E remains uncovered.
